title: About
text:
This is how you can create a quarto website with github and github pages
Start | Create GitHub Repo (DSCI521_website-test) on GitHub | Clone Repo Locally (git clone <repo_url>) | Create Quarto Project (quarto create project DSCI521_website-test) | Develop Your Site (Add .qmd Files, Modify _quarto.yml) | Render Quarto Site Locally (quarto render) | ———————————————- | Branch 1: Manual Deployment | |———————————————| | | | Create /docs Folder | | | | | Move Rendered Files from _site to /docs | | | | | Commit and Push Files to main Branch | | | | | Go to GitHub Repo Settings (Settings > Pages) | | | | | Set GitHub Pages Source to main > /docs | | | | | Finish (Site Deployed) | ———————————————- | | Branch 2: Deployment with quarto publish | |———————————————-| | Run quarto publish gh-pages | | | | | Quarto Renders Site and Switches to gh-pages | | | | | GitHub Creates and Initializes gh-pages Branch | | | | | Quarto Automatically Deploys to gh-pages | | | | | Switch Back to main | | | | | Changes Are Pushed to gh-pages | | | | | Go to GitHub Repo Settings (Settings > Pages) | | | | | Set GitHub Pages Source to gh-pages | | | | | Finish (Site Deployed via gh-pages) |

title: DSCI521_website-test
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.
